text:
Example: Capital asset pricing model
The expected return on the market is 15%, the risk-free rate is 8%, and the beta for
Stock B is 0.8. Compute the rate of return that would be expected (required) on this
stock.
Answer:
E(Rg)= 0.08 + 0.8 (0.15 - 0.08) = 0.136
Note: Beta < 1 so E(R3) < E(Rmke
